meanings.definition: The quality of being produced artificially or in a manner that is not natural.
meanings.sent1: Her factitiousness in the play impressed the audience with its artificiality.
meanings.sent2: The factitiousness of the painting was evident in its lack of natural brush strokes.
meanings.sent3: The factitiousness of the magician's tricks made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The factitiousness of the smile on her face was like a mask hiding her true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The factitiousness of the flowers in the garden made them look almost too perfect to be real.

meanings.definition: The state of being fake or contrived.
meanings.sent1: His factitiousness in pretending to be someone else was quickly discovered.
meanings.sent2: The factitiousness of the news article was revealed by thorough investigation.
meanings.sent3: The factitiousness of the situation made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The factitiousness of her apology rang hollow in his ears.
meanings.sent5: The factitiousness of his smile was evident in the way his eyes remained cold and distant.
